newsitem.title: NORWAY: Hydro fall burdens Oslo stock exchange.
newsitem.headline: Hydro fall burdens Oslo stock exchange.

text.p: Industrial giant Norsk Hydro, sliding the day after reporting disappointing third-quarter results, dragged down the Oslo Total index on Tuesday.
The Oslo Total index fell 0.23 percent to 876.50 points in brisk trade worth 867 million crowns, including 223 million crowns in Hydro, which has a 20 percent weighting on the bourse.
Hydro, which fell one percent to 301.50 crowns, on Monday announced it's third-quarter result was down 45 percent because of lower prices for aluminium and petrochemicals.
"But Hydro has not fallen as much as had been feared. The fall in aluminium prices was discounted for," one dealer said.
Seven analysts polled by Reuters downgraded Hydro's projected Earnings Per Share for 1996 by 7.2 percent to 25.70 crowns following the presentation.

A dealer said offshore group Awilco was up 1.67 percent at 61 crowns on an unconfirmed rumour that a solution was in sight with British Petroleum on problems linked to a delay in the production start at the Foinaven subsea installation.
